p: We were unable to describe the specific burden of A(H1N1) as the study period did not cover the 2009 pandemic season, and during the 2013‐2014 season, this serotype was co‐dominant with an A(H3N2) virus. However, in that particular season, the burden in the elderly was low, in line with previous findings. 9, 16 This observation was attributed to repeated exposures to the virus over a 40‐year period afterward 1918 17 resulting in a strong and long‐lasting immunity in the ≥60 years.
